newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Petrobras denies it halted oil imports.
newsitem.headline: Petrobras denies it halted oil imports.

text.p: Brazilian state oil firm Petrobras on Thursday denied a television report that it has halted oil imports and said it had no plans to reduce oil purchases.
"It is not true. There was no order from the Finance Ministry to halt imports," said Petrobras Supply Director Aurilio Fernandes Lima.
Mines and Energy Minister Raimundo Brito also denied the report.
In a statement, Brito said oil imports continue without any alteration and oil stocks and supply remain at usual levels.
Earlier today, TV Globo reported that Petrobras had suspended oil imports in a move to improve the country's trade figures. It also said the company had enough stock of oil for three months.
Brazil has posted monthly trade deficits since June last year and oil purchases account for a large slice of the country's imports.
Lima denied Petrobras had a three-month oil stock. "We do not have oil stocks sufficient to supply the market for three months," he said.
Brazil needs to continue importing between 500,000 and 550,000 barrels per day of crude oil and derivatives, he said.
Brazil produces 900,000 barrels of crude a day.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom 5521 5074151))
